anomaly-mode.help: Global blocking mode for rate-based anomalies.
anomaly-mode.name: anomaly-mode

options.help: After an anomaly is detected, allow the number of packets per second according to the anomaly configuration.
options.name: periodical

options.help: Block packets once an anomaly is detected. Overrides individual anomaly settings.
options.name: continuous

cp-accel-mode.help: IPS Pattern matching acceleration/offloading to CPx processors.
cp-accel-mode.name: cp-accel-mode

options.help: Offload basic pattern matching to CPx processors.
options.name: basic

options.help: Offload more types of pattern matching resulting in higher throughput than basic mode. Requires two CP8s or one CP9.
options.name: advanced

database.help: Regular or extended IPS database. Regular protects against the latest common and in-the-wild attacks. Extended includes protection from legacy attacks.
database.name: database

deep-app-insp-db-limit.help: Limit on number of entries in deep application inspection database (1 - 2147483647, 0 = use recommended setting)
deep-app-insp-db-limit.name: deep-app-insp-db-limit

deep-app-insp-timeout.help: Timeout for Deep application inspection (1 - 2147483647 sec., 0 = use recommended setting).
deep-app-insp-timeout.name: deep-app-insp-timeout

engine-count.help: Number of IPS engines running. If set to the default value of 0, FortiOS sets the number to optimize performance depending on the number of CPU cores.
engine-count.name: engine-count

fail-open.help: Enable to allow traffic if the IPS buffer is full. Default is disable and IPS traffic is blocked when the IPS buffer is full.
fail-open.name: fail-open

intelligent-mode.help: Enable/disable IPS adaptive scanning (intelligent mode). Intelligent mode optimizes the scanning method for the type of traffic.
intelligent-mode.name: intelligent-mode

ips-reserve-cpu.help: Enable/disable IPS daemon's use of CPUs other than CPU 0
ips-reserve-cpu.name: ips-reserve-cpu

options.help: Disable IPS daemon's use of CPUs other than CPU 0 (all daemons run on all CPUs).
options.name: disable

options.help: Enable IPS daemon's use of CPUs other than CPU 0.
options.name: enable

np-accel-mode.help: Acceleration mode for IPS processing by NPx processors.
np-accel-mode.name: np-accel-mode

packet-log-queue-depth.help: Packet/pcap log queue depth per IPS engine.
packet-log-queue-depth.name: packet-log-queue-depth

session-limit-mode.help: Method of counting concurrent sessions used by session limit anomalies. Choose between greater accuracy (accurate) or improved performance (heuristics).
session-limit-mode.name: session-limit-mode

options.help: Accurately count concurrent sessions, demands more resources.
options.name: accurate

options.help: Use heuristics to estimate the number of concurrent sessions. Acceptable in most cases.
options.name: heuristic

skype-client-public-ipaddr.help: Public IP addresses of your network that receive Skype sessions. Helps identify Skype sessions. Separate IP addresses with commas.
skype-client-public-ipaddr.name: skype-client-public-ipaddr

socket-size.help: IPS socket buffer size. Max and default value depend on available memory. Can be changed to tune performance.
socket-size.name: socket-size

sync-session-ttl.help: Enable/disable use of kernel session TTL for IPS sessions.
sync-session-ttl.name: sync-session-ttl

options.help: Enable use of kernel session TTL for IPS sessions.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable use of kernel session TTL for IPS sessions.
options.name: disable

interface.help: Specify outgoing interface to reach server.
interface.name: interface

interface-select-method.help: Specify how to select outgoing interface to reach server.
interface-select-method.name: interface-select-method

options.help: Set outgoing interface by SD-WAN or policy routing rules.
options.name: sdwan

source-ip.help: Source IP address used for TLS active probe.
source-ip.name: source-ip

source-ip6.help: Source IPv6 address used for TLS active probe.
source-ip6.name: source-ip6

vdom.help: Virtual domain name for TLS active probe.
vdom.name: vdom

traffic-submit.help: Enable/disable submitting attack data found by this FortiGate to FortiGuard.
traffic-submit.name: traffic-submit
